content:
This is how I've always done it (Windows). It preserves your whole existing setup.

Copy TB files from the old PC

- launch TB on the old PC

- go to TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- click the Application Basics > Profile Folder 'Open Folder' button

- the profile folder will open

- navigate three levels up to the AppData\Roaming folder

- close TB

- copy the AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird folder to a flash drive

---

Install and launch TB on the new PC, then start setting up the new profile. Skip this section if you've already installed TB and created a profile.

- on the 'Set Up Your Existing Email Address' screen, enter name and email address only

- click the 'Configure manually' link

- scroll down and click 'Cancel'

- exit setup

- close TB

---

Paste the copied TB files to the new PC

- open the AppData\Roaming folder like you did above

- delete the Thunderbird folder

- replace it with the Thunderbird folder from the flash drive

- launch TB
creator: siffemoz

content: The steps look reasonable, even though you could skip the step to 'Set Up Your Existing Email Address' on the new computer. The profile you created on the new PC will be erased anyway, when you delete the AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird directory there, and copy over the AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird directory from the old computer.
creator: christ1

content:
Okay, rechecking Density, Zoom, and Font Size under View.

I need to keep font size up. But I need both readable fonts *and* readable font sizes. Even at 30px, the default fonts are thin, hard to tell apart, and hard for me to read.

I already use the other font settings, they don't fix the message lists, settings, etc.

And combining reasonable font sizes in both sets of settings results in much larger font sizes in message panes.

content:
You may know what's here already: https://kb.mozillazine.org/Pane_and_menu_fonts

That page refers to: https://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?p=362520#362520 https://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?p=1888526#1888526 https://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?p=1899617#1899617 https://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?t=338238

If you're using CSS already, and you know how to set message body fonts, and you know about density, zoom, and font size in the View menu, you may already know about all the tools available. I don't know if anything can be done with fonts in the config editor that cannot be done through the user interface. You could see for yourself by going to the config editor in general settings and typing "font" in the search bar.

Do you need recommendations for thicker typefaces? What operating system are you on?

content:
I have heard of this where mail is coming into an unsubscribed folder. (even the sent folder) check that all folders you see are included when polling for new mails (right click > properties) the trash and junk folders are not by default.

Check the subscriptions for the account (right click the account in the folder pane and select subscribe) meke sure all folders for the account are subscribed.

content:
I have the same settings as yourself. 

"Check for updates, but let me choose whether to install them"

I also unchecked the option "Use a background service to install updates" as this then forces the UAC to ask if I really want to update. It basically means I do get a second chance to back out of update if selected by accident.

I'm currently using two versions 128.14.0esr (I had to get that version from https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ because it was not offering it - I was offered upgrade to the current release). I'm also running beta 144.0b1

I've not had any pop ups or any other sign that mention/prompt an update is available for a long time, but I've always had the options via 'Help' > 'About Thunderbird' and also via 'Settings' > 'General' > Updates section.

Which means it is checking for updates, but it seems it's up to me to check either of those locations to know if an update is available.

There did used to be a green dot which appeared on the 3 line menu app icon when an update was available but I've not seen that in a while. I'll try to find out if that was stopped at some point.

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail errate -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

content:
Thanks, yes, but that is the same regarding 12s to empty 6 accounts. - would be swell to have a setting or if I can revert version v115.x to get back to normal I had for 10+ years.

v128.x was offered as upgrade to v115.x on the menu, twice a couple of days ago. First unsure if that v140.x was some kind of beta, but checked out internet what "esr" meant and felt v140.x is probably ok release.

TBH, there is a saying "if it works, don't fix it" and I really would like to turn off updates. If I get this fixed, I will ignore updates in future. Always new bugs introduced, one that I reported too about clearing statusfield always as in Search Messages dialog, which is better as it was saying "no matches" or a number that stayed there until dialog closed.

This seems to me somebody changed the class for statusfield messages, and did not think of that sometimes that field should have last message still, like in Search Messages. - so same class used all over without really checking where it is used - I have a separate report on this posted yesterday

Other things that happend with new version was that Search Messages suddenly searched all accounts which became over the top, and had to find a setting to turn that off. - I have all email almost 20 years back in this computer on these accounts - very convenient to check out when you purchased things if on warranty and stuff

When it comes to handling multiple accounts Thunderbird is the best there is, and donated three times above the suggested amount when reminded to show appreciation for your work.

I searched all over how to revert version and found an extensive post about it, and seems really cumbersome, so would be nice to have it fixed instead. - not sure how much is wiped out by uninstalling, after some preparations with certain files and whatnot - it would not hurt with a simple "revert to previous" or similar

Thanks again for response and for reading this much to long post...

Regards

content:
Thanks a million. That fixed this and a another thing too. It turned out I was running 115.16.3 before updates a couple of days ago, but just changed url to pick the correct version. - in my case win32 and en-GB as language

This was my procedure to revert version.

So had a backup from late august - took the current profile from Users\loginname....Roaming and copied to a folder on disk - took the current profile from Users\loginname....Local and copied to a folder on disk

Uninstalled v140.3 Copied above folders and overwrite what was the current profile in those too places This way it said a version so installer would not see this as downgrade Installed 115.16.3 All howdy doody!

This fixed now empty 6 accounts in a flash as I'm used to, and status text in Search Messages remains as before, not removed after 1s. And no hack needed to have date format from system settings, and not default for country as happend in more recent versions.

I migrated this install from an XP machine 5 years ago and think my install says Locked in Profiles.ini. - so moved at the time all emails and stuff - if this matters what needs to be done

I will stay on this forever....
creator: gog756

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
I'm not sure, but I think I see two things that may be helpful.

1) It seems that the messages in your screenshot are grouped by sort. If you sorted by "threaded" instead, messages in a thread would be sorted in chronological order, so the latest message would be the last one in the list. If you don't sort by "threaded", you are not really using threads. You seem to be organizing messages by subject instead of by thread. Is that right?

2) Your screenshot shows only "Thursday" for date and time. I don't know why. My messages always have date and time. Maybe information here will help you change "Thursday" to date and time so that you can compare times visually. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/customize-date-time-formats-thunderbird
creator: mozilla98

content:
Will Thunderbird ... allow me to continue using my @comcast.net accounts?

Thunderbird is an email client, it is supposed to do exactly that. Run the new account wizard to set up your existing Comcast accounts. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/automatic-account-configuration

Since Comcast uses OAuth2 authentication also make sure to allow cookies in Thunderbird.
creator: christ1

content:
You can try to change the Layout

Go to the View menu at the top of Thunderbird.

Select Layout.

Choose Table View. Maybe that help you.

To get your buttons back

Right-click on an empty space in the toolbar.

Select Customize... from the menu.

A new window will open showing all the available buttons. Find the buttons you want.

Drag and drop the buttons onto your toolbar.
